title: Build an Infinite Runner Game with Unity and the Realm Unity SDK
description:
Did you know that MongoDB has a Realm SDK for the Unity game development framework that makes working with game data effortless? It’s currently an alpha release, but you can already start using it to build persistence into your cross platform gaming projects.

If you’re unfamiliar with the infinite runner concept, the idea is that you have a player that can move horizontally to fixed positions. As the game progresses, obstacles and rewards enter the scene. When (& Why) You Should Use Change Data Capture
description: Change Data Capture (CDC) can simplify and improve both your application and data architectures. The trick is to figure out the most effective use cases where employing CDC will have the desired impact. In this blog, I’m going to unpack two useful CDC use cases: The first is streaming data to your data warehouse and the second is event-driven architectures. By no means are these the only two use cases for change data capture, but they are excellent examples for demonstrating the ways that CDC can simplify application and data architecture.
